page.title: 03CLAYTON PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: The Parish Council is responsible for many things such as footways, lighting, recreation grounds and trees. They are the trustees for the District Council and make sure that all bills are paid. The records go back to 23 November 1896 when the parish council started. The money that the Parish Council needs is given to them by the District Council. There are eleven people on the Parish Council. The Parish Council is planning to build a new pavilion at Clayton Green which is going to be one of their projects. The Queen's dressmaker whose name was Norman Hartnell is buried at Clayton. Pyecombe parish extends south and west of Clayton. Each month a magazine "The Pyecombe Parish News" duplicated by the Clerk includes articles and events relating to village life.
